#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Fort Lauderdale Airport shooting suspect appears in court
#Text=Thursday , January 12 , 2017
#Text=Esteban Ruiz Santiago , 26 , appeared in federal court in Fort Lauderdale , Broward County , Florida this Monday .

#Text=Santiago stands accused of a shooting at Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport on Friday at 12:55 p.m. local time ( 1755 UTC ) at the lower level baggage claim area in Terminal 2 of the airport .
#Text=The incident killed five people and injured six , with roughly another 40 people injured in the crowd while hastily evacuating from the scene .
#Text=Esteban Santiago mug shot , January 7 , 2017 .
#Text=Image : Broward County Sheriff 's Office , Florida .
#Text=Police drove Santiago from the Broward County main jail to the court building in the morning .
#Text=At the hearing , Santiago attended handcuffed and also cuffed at the ankles , guarded by at least eight police officers .
#Text=The Magistrate , Judge Alicia Valle , questioned Santiago on his finances .
#Text=The prosecutor also sought a detention order for public safety and flight risk .
#Text=The hearing took about 20 minutes .
#Text=The Judge ordered Santiago a public defender , and set a detention hearing for January 17 , and the arraignment hearing for January 23 .
#Text=After the hearing , the police returned Santiago to the Broward County main jail .
#Text=At the hearing , Santiago had admitted to earning US$ 2,100 a month as a security guard in Alaska , while only having about US$ 10 of savings in a bank , and no other property .
#Text=The Judge also informed Santiago of the penalties that may be imposed on him in the case he was convicted .
#Text=On Friday , authorities said , Santiago arrived from Anchorage , Alaska with only one baggage item — a suitcase with an unloaded Glock 9 mm semi-automatic handgun .
#Text=Upon arriving at the airport , he picked up the suitcase at the baggage claim carousel and loaded it in a nearby bathroom .
#Text=Then he walked out and started shooting people , at random according to a witness .
#Text=People started to run and hide , and Santiago continued to shoot .
#Text=Then Santiago stopped shooting , witnesses claiming he ran out of ammunition .
#Text=The police arrested him .
#Text=He did not resist the arrest .

#Text=According to officials , Santiago received a mental health evaluation in November , after he traveled to an FBI office and walked in alleging his head was controlled by the government and he heard voices urging him to watch ISIS propaganda .
#Text=At the time of that incident he left his infant son and a gun in a car , and the infant was given to mother 's care .
#Text=His gun was seized at the time of that incident , but Santiago was given it back on December 8 .
#Text=Santiago traveled from Anchorage , Alaska to Minneapolis to Fort Lauderdale Airport on a Delta Airlines flight .
#Text=Investigations were ongoing to determine the motivation for the incident .
#Text=No evidence was found of Santiago communicating with any other individual in relation to the incident ; he seemed to be acting alone .
#Text=In an interview , Santiago admitted to having planned the shooting in advance when purchasing the airline ticket .
#Text=According to CNN , Esteban Santiago previously belonged to the Alaska Army National Guard , including a ten-month stint in Iraq where he was given a combat action badge .
#Text=According to Santiago 's family , his mental health issues started after his ten-month tour in Iraq , after which he began to tell them about auditory hallucinations .
#Text=All flights to and from Fort Lauderdale Airport were suspended by the Federal Aviation Administration ( FAA ) until Saturday morning , and roads in and out of the airport closed .
#Text=Santiago was born in New Jersey .
#Text=He spent his childhood in Puerto Rico , an unincorporated US territory in the northeastern Caribbean Sea .
#Text=At the time of the incident , it was legal in the US to transport guns in a hard-sided and locked container by air .
#Text=In Florida , it was also legal to carry a gun in an airport terminal without removing the gun from its case .
